terms.definition: A concise, single-page document that outlines the key aspects of a product or feature proposal, including goals, scope, and success criteria, used to gain stakeholder support and alignment.
Individuals or groups who have an interest in or are affected by a project's outcome, including executives, team members, customers, and investors.
Portable Document Format - a file format that preserves document formatting across different devices and platforms, commonly used for sharing documentation.
The gradual expansion of a project's requirements or features beyond its original defined boundaries, often leading to delays and budget overruns.
The accumulated cost of additional work caused by choosing quick, easy solutions instead of better approaches that would take longer to implement.
The first major release of a software product or feature that includes all essential functionality for public or production use.
Measurable values that demonstrate how effectively a company or project is achieving key business objectives.
The overall experience and satisfaction a user has when interacting with a product, system, or service, often abbreviated as UX.
The systematic process of ensuring that products or services meet specified requirements and quality standards before release.
Detailed technical documents that outline the architecture, specifications, and implementation plan for a software project or product.
The percentage of total sales in an industry or market that is captured by a particular company or product.
The group of developers, designers, and other professionals responsible for building and deploying a product or feature according to specifications.
Specific, measurable conditions or outcomes that must be achieved for a project to be considered successful.
A web-based URL that provides access to documents or resources stored on cloud servers, allowing easy sharing and collaboration.
A security feature that restricts access to documents or systems by requiring users to enter a valid password before viewing or editing content.
